chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. Thurber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 2-10-16;; unpaid court obligations of $443

15CF205 & 15CF231 called at 3:08 p.m., Defendant Gregory J. Thurber in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing statement made. Court sentenced defendant in 15CF205 to 9 months jail on ct. 1, Huber granted. $443 costs, 158 days jail credit. In 15CF231 to 9 month jail, concurrent with 15CF205, Huber granted. $93 costs No jail credit in 15CF231. Court adjourned at 3:26 p.m.
Appointed Attorney Peter Masana

Defendant Gregory J. Thurber in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF205 and 15CF231 called.  Amended complaint filed in 15CF205.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of 15CF231 and to Ct. 1 of 15CF205 amended complaint.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 15CF231 Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  In both cases, Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation are costs of $443.00 on each case, costs are to be paid within the first year of probation.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  2 days jail credit due in 15CF231.
